Gambling is fun, but no one likes to place a bet on a random Bitcoin casino. We wish to help you make your selection – this is why we have made a list of the best Australian crypto casinos and their amazing bonuses. Keep reading to learn more about them!

If you are into esports betting, this is the place for you. Thunderpick provides you with a selection of 15 different esports and 16 different spots to bet on, but you also have a very decent selection of other games if those are more your style (around 800 slots, over 100 table games as well as live games). You can gamble with 9 different cryptocurrencies, including Bitcoin, Ethereum, Litecoin, Dogecoin and more.

If you want to play games at BitStarz, the only personal information that they require from you is your email address, just like at Thunderpick. At BitStarz you can choose between lots of game providers and over 3,500 games, including provably fair games, which is a nice plus. This casino has very highly rated support agents and high betting limits for high rollers. As far as their promotions are concerned, BitStarz casino offers an exclusive no deposit bonus and they have a generous welcome package that comes in four parts. You can gamble with 6 different cryptocurrencies at this casino, but they also accept a number of fiat currencies if you like to stick to the tried and true.

Next on our list is BCGame casino. If you happen to be a fan of the more obscure and rare cryptocurrencies, do not worry – this Bitcoin allows you to play with over 60 different cryptos! You will almost certainly find the altcoin of your choice on their extensive list of cryptos payment methods. BCGame does require a few more pieces of personal information though: email, first name, last name, and date of birth are required so that you can play and withdraw your winnings. They have unlimited max. deposits and withdrawals and unlimited bets on slots and table games. They even have an app for both Android and iOS, so you can play your favorite games even when travelling. Lastly, you definitely don’t want to overlook BCGame Bitcoin casino’s VIP program – their VIP offers consist of amazing prizes such as daily free coins, daily drops and giveaways, secret treasures, personal VIP manager, and for the top-tier VIP members even weeks of celebrity treatment and all expenses paid trips to exotic destinations!

Also ranking very high is TrustDice. Only your email is required to create an account and play at this casino. They offer a selection of their own provably fair Bitcoin games. In addition to classic casino and slot games, they also have sports and a few esports where you can place your bets. TrustDice casino offers their players well-rated, reliable support options via email or live chat. You can gamble with Bitcoin, Ethereum, Tether, EOS and even a couple more crypto currencies. TrustDice’s specialty, however, are faucet crypto bonuses; these are bonuses of very small amounts of crypto. You can earn them passively by watching ads, doing surveys, or completing other small tasks on a website that offers such a type of bonus. TrustDice offers these faucet bonuses not only in Bitcoin but also in a few other cryptocurrencies.

Wolfy casino has a selection of over 5,000 casino games, but this website does require a bit more personal information when you sign up (email, date of birth, mobile number, first name, last name, and address are required to play and withdraw). Don’t be discouraged though – this casino has many reasons why you should give their games a try. Wolfy has a generous bonus list which consists of a welcome package, a crypto welcome bonus, two weekend reloads and even weekly free spins. They have apps for Android and iOS which gives you a lot of flexibility and possibility to truly play anywhere. When placing your bets, you can pay with 9 different cryptocurrencies as well as with 4 fiat currencies.

Last but not least, we have FortuneJack. This online Bitcoin casino does not require any other personal information when you sign up besides your email address. Like some of the casinos we have already mentioned, FortuneJack also has a category of provably fair Bitcoin casino games. You can pay with one of 8 different cryptocurrencies, but they also accept fiat if that is more your style. They have unlimited max. deposits and max. withdrawals and a generous welcome package that comes in four parts. They offer over 1,100 slots, over 50 roulette games and over 110 poker games to keep you entertained.

Not every licensed crypto casino automatically makes the cut – you are not looking for “good enough,” are you? First, here are some basic terms and requirements for the best Bitcoin casino. What sets a good crypto casino apart from a great crypto casino is the following, which we have taken into consideration when compiling this list:

  • Bonuses and bonus terms (a Bitcoin casino may offer anything from cashback, reloads, free spins, or even a no deposit bonus),
  • Variety and number of games (just because you’re playing with crypto does not mean that you should settle for casinos with fewer game options),
  • Quick transactions and payouts (nobody wants to wait ages to receive their winnings),
  • Number of crypto currencies you can gamble with (while it is generally the most popular, not everyone prefers Bitcoin),
  • And of course, the overall experience that a particular online casino offers (what belongs here is responsive and helpful customer support, clear terms and conditions, and all the other details that make playing at a particular casino memorable in the most positive way)

Why Choose an Australia Crypto Casino?

Why is crypto gambling so popular and why are more and more online Bitcoin casinos deciding to add cryptocurrencies to their payment options? Let’s break it down – this way of paying and receiving money is very popular because it offers anonymity, security and comes with low costs attached to it.
When you gamble with crypto you transfer funds with your crypto wallet address. If you make a transaction at an online casino of your choice, you basically link your wallet to the crypto wallet of that casino and make a deposit. What crypto allows you to do is to deposit a lot of money quickly and with minimal fees (especially when compared to bank or credit card transactions).

These transactions are done on the blockchain network where it is very difficult to counterfeit money, steal it, or hack the network in a way that would go undetected. While it is worth noting that stealing your crypto is not impossible, it is much more complicated. If someone wanted to steal your money they would need not only your ewallet address, but also your private keys in order to actually access your money.

Depending on the casino withdrawal limits may vary, but payouts with crypto currencies are really fast, taking on average a few minutes to a couple of hours. Larger sums of money will typically take a bit longer for crypto too. This is not surprising; more confirmations may be required in order to provide more security where big sums are involved.

People still tend to be skeptical of Bitcoin and the legality of crypto – which is a topic exactly of this next chapter – but there is really no particular disadvantage of crypto currencies. Volatility of crypto may be one potential drawback since the value of altcoins like Bitcoin can indeed change rapidly, but all of the advantages listed above certainly make crypto an interesting alternative to traditional fiat currencies. Using crypto over fiat at online casinos has never been easier, and this holds true for Australian players as well.

Is Gambling with Crypto Legal in Australia?

Crypto currencies have gained a lot of popularity in recent years which also means that the demand for them is gradually increasing in the world of online gambling. Online Bitcoin casino sites nowadays tend to have a hybrid payment system (sites where you can play with crypto and fiat currencies), but some are also focusing on a crypto-only system where only altcoins – Bitcoin, Tether, Ethereum and more – are accepted as a payment method.

Online gambling cannot be regulated in the same way as laws pertaining to land casinos, since online casinos do not technically exist within a country’s borders. An online Bitcoin casino may be based in a jurisdiction where gambling is indeed perfectly legal and this casino may have a license from that jurisdiction, and this concept puts the question of allowing foreign players into a bit of a gray area.

When it comes to legality of crypto gambling in Australia, the case is similar to many countries; there is no law that strictly and clearly prohibits Bitcoin gambling, but there is also no law that bans crypto gambling. In short, gambling with cryptocurrencies in Australia is technically allowed, but let us take a look at some specifics and this country’s attitude towards gambling in recent years.

Australia’s federal interactive gambling laws technically prohibit slots, poker and online casinos as well as instant lotteries and wagering services that accept betting on live sports.

The 2001 Interactive Gambling Act states that it is illegal for companies to offer or advertise online gambling services to Australian residents. Yet things are not quite as simple as this.

Firstly, and not surprisingly, this law does not apply to companies based outside of Australia. The Interactive Gambling Act of 2001 applies only to Australian gambling companies that provide real money services. But what is really important and interesting is the fact that the law only focuses on operators of such websites.

For example, an Australia-based online casino company is allowed to offer gambling services to foreign players that are not based in Australia, but it cannot advertise to or allow Aussie players access to their services.

On the other hand, a foreign online casino company that has for example a Costa Rica or Curacao gambling license can legally offer its services to Australian players (so long as it does not promote and advertise their casino though Aussie media).

Interestingly enough, a great number of top crypto casinos get a lot of players from Australia to visit and bet at their online websites. If you have ever checked a few Bitcoin casinos, you have probably noticed that chances are if the casino accepts fiat currencies, they will be accepting AUD among them.

Adding cryptocurrencies to online Bitcoin casino payment methods has opened up new possibilities for players all around the globe. For many players crypto gambling allows them to enjoy their hobby whilst maintaining anonymity online, and on top of this it allows for decentralized, fast and secure transactions.

If you want to give crypto gambling a try or already love it but are still looking to improve your odds, check out the best bonuses and casinos for Australian players mentioned here – you won’t regret it!
